title: Upper Yoke - Removal

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Seat, Battery and Fuel Tank - Removal

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: HF7; HJ7; HH7; HG7; HE7; HD7 (do not use - delete if found in use); HDA; HD6; HD5; HD4; HD; HD2
HF7; HJ7; HH7; HG7; HE7; HD7 (do not use - delete if found in use); HDA; HD6; HD5; HD4; HD; HD2

body.body: Note the routing of the harnesses around the right hand side of the headstock for installation.
Remove the cable guide on the right hand side of the headstock. Discard the fixings.
Remove the rubber band from the cables on the right hand side of the headstock.

body.name: Headstock right hand cable guide L0423

body.body: Note the position and the routing of the ignition switch harness for installation.
Follow the routing of the ignition switch harness and disconnect it from the main harness. Free the ignition switch harness from the right hand frame infill panel.
Note the routing of the harnesses through the upper yoke wire guide for installation.
Release and discard the lock nuts and remove the wire guide from the underside of the upper yoke.
Release the fixings securing the handlebar clamps to the risers, detach the clamps and release the handlebar.

As an assembly, raise the handle bars until clear of the upper yoke. Rest the assembly forward of the steering stem such that access to the upper yoke centre nut is unrestricted. Ensure the master cylinder remains in an upright position.
Loosen the upper yoke pinch bolts.
If the lower yoke fixings are also loosened, the forks will no longer support the weight of the motorcycle.
Do not loosen the lower yoke fixings as, in this condition, the motorcycle could topple over causing damage and/or risk of injury.

Care must be taken when removing the upper yoke centre nut, to ensure that the centre nut and upper yoke do not become scratched. Protect the surfaces with a suitable cloth or tape to prevent scratching.
Remove the upper yoke centre nut.
Ease the upper yoke from the forks and remove from the motorcycle.

search: Upper Yoke - Removal
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Perform the following operations:
Seat - Removal
Battery - Removal
Fuel Tank - Removal
Note the routing of the harnesses around the right hand side of the headstock for installation.
Remove the cable guide on the right hand side of the headstock. Discard the fixings.
Remove the rubber band from the cables on the right hand side of the headstock.
Fixings
Cable guide
Rubber band
Note the position and the routing of the ignition switch harness for installation.
Follow the routing of the ignition switch harness and disconnect it from the main harness. Free the ignition switch harness from the right hand frame infill panel.
Note the routing of the harnesses through the upper yoke wire guide for installation.
Release and discard the lock nuts and remove the wire guide from the underside of the upper yoke.
Lock nut (right hand side shown)
Wire guide
Release the fixings securing the handlebar clamps to the risers, detach the clamps and release the handlebar.

As an assembly, raise the handle bars until clear of the upper yoke. Rest the assembly forward of the steering stem such that access to the upper yoke centre nut is unrestricted. Ensure the master cylinder remains in an upright position.
Loosen the upper yoke pinch bolts.
If the lower yoke fixings are also loosened, the forks will no longer support the weight of the motorcycle.
Do not loosen the lower yoke fixings as, in this condition, the motorcycle could topple over causing damage and/or risk of injury.

Care must be taken when removing the upper yoke centre nut, to ensure that the centre nut and upper yoke do not become scratched. Protect the surfaces with a suitable cloth or tape to prevent scratching.
Remove the upper yoke centre nut.
Upper yoke centre nut
Ease the upper yoke from the forks and remove from the motorcycle.
